title: 108_hr1276
content: The Act is titled the "American Dream Downpayment Act" and amends the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act to include a Downpayment Assistance Initiative. The Secretary may grant funds to help low-income families achieve homeownership through downpayment assistance for single-family housing. Eligible families must be low-income and first-time homebuyers or include a uniformed employee. The term 'eligible family' refers to low-income families who are first-time homebuyers or include a uniformed employee, such as policemen, firemen, teachers, or maintenance workers, receiving downpayment assistance from the participating jurisdiction. The downpayment assistance program is available to eligible families with incomes not exceeding 115-150 percent of the median income of the area, with adjustments for family size. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a participating jurisdiction must include in its housing affordability strategy a plan for using grant funds and conducting targeted outreach to residents of public housing, trailer parks, and manufactured homes. The income limitation for the program is 150 percent of the median income of the area, with adjustments for family size. For a fiscal year, a participating jurisdiction must include in its housing affordability strategy a description of grant use, a plan for outreach to residents of public housing, trailer parks, and manufactured homes for downpayment assistance, and actions to ensure suitability for homeownership. Formula allocation is determined annually by the Secretary. For downpayment assistance, participating jurisdictions must include a plan for outreach to residents in need and ensure their suitability for homeownership. The Secretary allocates funds based on jurisdiction's need and prior commitment to assisting homebuyers. The formula for allocating funds to participating jurisdictions for homebuyer assistance considers various sources of prior year commitments, such as the HOME investment partnerships program and mortgage revenue bonds. Reallocation of funds to other jurisdictions is done according to the established formula if funds become available. The Secretary determines reallocation of funds to participating jurisdictions under this section. Funds may be reallocated according to the formula established in subsection (d), with exceptions for local jurisdictions in states that did not receive allocated amounts. Grants under this section are not subject to certain provisions of the title but are subject to provisions of title I, section 215(b). Grants under this section are not subject to certain provisions of the title but are subject to provisions of title I, sections 215(b), 218, 219, 221, 223, 224, and 226(a) of subtitle A. In paragraph (2), references to funds under subtitle A are considered to refer to amounts for assistance under this section. References to funds allocated under section 217 or 217(d) are considered to refer to amounts allocated under subsection (d) or (e) of this section. Participating jurisdictions can use funds under subtitle A for administrative and planning costs. Authorization of appropriations is provided. Participating jurisdictions can use funds under subtitle A for administrative and planning costs. Authorization of appropriations is provided for $200,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2004 and 2005. Relocation and downpayment assistance are also included in the amendments to the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act. The Uniform Relocation Assistance and Real Property Acquisition Policies Act of 1970 does not apply to downpayment assistance under this title. Passed by the House of Representatives on October 1, 2003.
